result.execSummary:
The defendant Andres R Morales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andres R Morales is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andres R Morales was found guilty of Escape-Criminal Arrest [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically a psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment including taking all medications as prescribed. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless a sample has previously been provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andres R Morales

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

BTC: Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES - STAYED. 2 yrs prob

Defendant Andres R Morales in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Andres R Morales in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  PLQ form has been filed.  State recommends Plea to Ct. 2  period of jail is recommended.  Defendant enters a G plea to Ct 2 and is found G.  Ct. 1 is dismissed  Judge conducts the plea colloquey.   BTC:  PSI ordered.  Def. req. PSI be waived, Judge denies request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
for reduction of bail; filed by Atty Walker.

Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc.
